sen.j: 関根 祥六（せきね しょうろく、1930年（昭和5年） -）とは、シテ方観世流能楽師。
sen.e: Shoroku SEKINE (１９３０－) is a leading traditional Japanese Noh drama performer and member of the Kanze school (one of the 5 major Noh troupes).
Shoroku SEKINE (１９３０－) is a leading traditional Japanese Noh drama performer and member of the Kanze school (one of the 5 major Noh troupes).
Shoroku SEKINE (1930 -) is a leading traditional Japanese Noh drama performer (shite-kata) and member of the Kanze school (one of the 5 major Noh troupes).
Shoroku is the 6th son of Ryusuke SEKINE
Shoroku is the 6th son of Ryusuke SEKINE
Shoroku is the 6th son of Ryusuke SEKINE

sen.j: 兄関根直孝及び二十五世宗家観世元正に師事。
sen.e: Shoroku`s elder brother is Naotaka SEKINE； who studied under Motomasa KANZE (25th hereditary head of the KANZE family).
Shoroku`s elder brother is Naotaka SEKINE； who studied under Motomasa KANZE (25th hereditary head of the KANZE family).
Shoroku studied under Naotaka SEKINE, his elder brother and Motomasa KANZE (25th hereditary head of the KANZE family).
sen.cmt: 師弟関係が正しくないようなので再構成しました。

sen.j: 重要無形文化財総合指定保持者。
sen.e: Shoroku is acknowledged as an `important intangible cultural asset`.
Shoroku is acknowledged as an `important intangible cultural asset`.
Shoroku is acknowledged as the 'general holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property.'
He is recipient of art festival awards for excellence.
He is recipient of art festival awards for excellence.
He is recipient of art festival awards for excellence.
He is recipient of the Medal with Purple Ribbon award.
He is recipient of the Medal with Purple Ribbon award.
He is recipient of the Medal with Purple Ribbon award.
In 2002 he received the Japan Art Academy award.
In 2002 he received the Japan Art Academy award.
In 2002 he received the Award of the Japan Art Academy.
His eldest son is Yoshito SEKINE.
His eldest son is Yoshito SEKINE.
